entry.title: Bean Burgers
entry.content:
This is very easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

Preparation time
about 10 mins
Cooking time
30 minutes in a conventional Oven or 10 minutes frying
makes 4 pies
freeze before cooking

Ingredients

  • 4 cans of beans of your choice I use Black Eyed Beans, red Kidney Beans, Brorlotti beans and Butter Beans
  • 1 red Onion
  • 1 Flax Egg ( 2 desert spoons of Flaxseed 6 desert spoons of Hot Water
  • seasoning ( to taste)
    • <li 2 tablespoons of vegetable oil </li?
    • 3 teaspoon garlic powder
    • 3 teaspoons of cumin
    • 1 teaspoon of cayenne pepper

Method

Step 1) Make the Flax Egg, this is simply either flaxseed or chai seed and water, I use 1 dessertspoon of flaxseed and 3 dessertspoons of water. Add boiling water to the flaxseed and mix well. then leave to cool..

Step 2) Chop the Onion and then pulse in a food mixer. I am not very keen on Onions so I make this really fine but you may like it chunky !

Step 3) Add the beans and pulse or mix until you have either a fine or coarse bean mixture. My food processor seemed to produce a mixture of both consistencies

Step 5) Seasoning - add the seasoning to the mixture and stir well, feel free to add different amounts and types. the stiring didnt work well in the food mixer so I put the ingredients in a bowl and sired by hand.

Step 6) Make the burgers by hand, to get the same about per burger I used 2 large dessertspoons of mixture per burger and then formed by hand.

Step 7) cook for around 30 mins or so in the oven or fry for 5 minutes each side with a little vegetable oil.

Item Value per burger
Calories 139
Protein 9g
Carbohydrates 17g
Fiber 8g
Fat 2g of which 0 is saturated

These burgers are packed with beans, the clue is in the name ! Batch make them they are a good thing to pull out of the freezer as and when needed.
entry.summary: This is very easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

entry.title: Cottage Pie
entry.content:
This is easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

Preperation time
about 10 mins
Cooking time
30 minutes in a conventional Oven
makes 4 pies
freeze before cooking

Ingredients

  • 120g green lentils
  • 1 can cannellini beans or your beans of choice
  • 1 can Borlotti beans or your beans of choice
  • 125g of garden peas
  • 175g carrots
  • 700g white potatoes for the toppings
  • 200mg Almond milk if using potatoes for topping
  • 1 vegetarian stock cube
  • seasoning ( to taste)
    • 1 ½ teaspoons gravy granules
    • ½ teaspoon garlic powder
    • 1 ½ teaspoons of cumin
    • ½ teaspoons of cayenne pepper

Method

##image is 427x240

Step 1) Cook lentils – cover with water and bring to the boil then let simmer for around 20 mins. Boil potatoes for around the same time.

Step 2) Make the gravy - crumble the veg stock cube and add the gravy granules into around 1 pint, or more if you like. Microwave for 2 mins and stir then microwave for another minute when you are going to add to the lentils.

Step 3) Add beans - once the lentils are cooked add the beans, I always drain first because they come with preservative water in most tins which you do not need. If you are using potatoes then mash these with the Almond milk or you can use margarine if you wish.

Step 4) Add carrots and peas - Chop carrots finely, no need to peel them just a quick scrub and top and tail them add to lentils, add the garden peas, these can be straight from frozen.

Step 5) Seasoning - add the seasoning to the mixture and stir well, feel free to add different amounts and types.

Step 6) decant into pie containers or use cookwear or thing that will be an appropriate oven/freezer proof container. Add the lids and score the top with a fork ( to get crispy bits).

Step 7) cook for around 30 mins or so on around 180degrees for a fan oven or 200degrees for a conventional oven. Any left over pies can be frozen prior to cooking. Serve with loads of Veg and the left over gravy.

Item Value per Pie
Calories 358
Protein 16g
Carbohydrates 65g
Fiber 15g
Fat 2g of which 0.5 is saturated

These pie’s are very filling and because you can batch make them they are a good thing to pull out of the freezer as and when needed.
entry.summary: This is easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients.

entry.title: Lentil and Bean Pies
entry.content:
This is easy to make and only has a few readily available ingredients. There are two options but the one with the potato top isn’t really a pie and more resembles a cottage pie, still delicious though!

Preperation time
about 10 mins
Cooking time
30 minutes in a conventional Oven
makes 6 pies
freeze before cooking

Ingredients

  • 120g green lentils
  • 1 can cannellini beans or your beans of choice
  • 1 can Borlotti beans or your beans of choice
  • 125g of garden peas
  • 175g carrots
  • Shortcrust pastry enough for 6 lids ( 1 pack of easy roll 375g)
  • 200mg Almond milk if using potatoes for topping
  • 1 vegetarian stock cube
  • seasoning
    • 1 ½ teaspoons gravy granules
    • ½ teaspoon garlic powder
    • 1 ½ teaspoons of cumin
    • ½ teaspoons of cayenne pepper

Method

Step 1) Cook lentils – cover with water and bring to the boil then let simmer for around 20 mins.

Step 2) Make the gravy - crumble the veg stock cube and add the gravy granules into around 1 pint, or more if you like. Microwave for 2 mins and stir then microwave for another minute when you are going to add to the lentils.

Step 3) Add beans - once the lentils are cooked add the beans, I always drain first because they come with preservative water in most tins which you do not need. If you are using potatoes then mash these with the Almond milk or you can use margarine if you wish.

Step 4) Add carrots and peas - Chop carrots finely, no need to peel them just a quick scrub and top and tail them add to lentils, add the garden peas, these can be straight from frozen.

Step 5) Seasoning - add the seasoning to the mixture and stir well, feel free to add different amounts and types.

Step 6) decant into pie containers or use cookwear or thing that will be an appropriate oven/freezer proof container. Add the lids and decorate with whatever design you wish.

Step 7) cook for around 30 mins or so on around 180degrees for a fan oven or 200degrees for a conventional oven. Any left over pies can be frozen prior to cooking. Serve with loads of Veg and the left over gravy.

Nutrients

Item Value per Pie
Calories 406
Protein 13g
Carbohydrates 42g
Fiber 10g
Fat 19g of which 7 is saturated

These pie’s are very filling and because you can batch make them they are a good thing to pull out of the freezer as and when needed.

entry.title: Layout: Header Video
entry.content:
This post should display a **header with a responsive video**, if the theme supports it. ## Settings | Parameter | Required | Description | |---------- |--------- | ----------- | | `id` | **Required** | ID of the video | | `provider` | **Required** | Hosting provider of the video, either `youtube` or `vimeo` | ### YouTube To embed the following YouTube video at url `https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XsxDH4HcOWA` (long version) or `https://youtu.be/XsxDH4HcOWA` (short version) into a post or page's main content you'd use: ```liquid {% include video id="XsxDH4HcOWA" provider="youtube" %} ```
To embed it as a video header you'd use the following YAML Front Matter ```yaml header: video: id: XsxDH4HcOWA provider: youtube ``` ### Vimeo To embed the following Vimeo video at url `https://vimeo.com/212731897` into a post or page's main content you'd use: ```liquid {% include video id="212731897" provider="vimeo" %} ```
To embed it as a video header you'd use the following YAML Front Matter ```yaml header: video: id: 212731897 provider: vimeo ```
entry.summary: This post should display a **header with a responsive video**, if the theme supports it.
